title: Christian Pulisic is left in TEARS on the bench after being taken off during USA's defeat by Canada
text:
Christian Pulisic's difficult start to the season appeared to take hold on Tuesday as he was left in tears having been substituted on international duty.

The 21-year-old was withdrawn on the hour mark with the United States drawing 0-0 with rivals Canada.

Canada went on to win the game 2-0, their first victory over the US in 34 years, after goals from Alphonse Davies and Lucas Cavallini.

Christian Pulisic was in tears on the bench after being taken off against Canada

The United States star was unable to hold it together following his withdrawal on 60 minutes

Pulisic is enduring a difficult start to the season for club and country and it took its toll

United States boss Gregg Berhalter said after that Pulisic had 'flu-like symptoms' in the game

Pulisic is the star of Gregg Berhalter's side and so his withdrawal, given his emotional reaction, raised questions as to why he was taken off with the game in the balance.

Berhalter tried to justify the substitution following the defeat by revealing that the player had 'light fever' and was exhibiting 'flu-like symptoms' in the second half.

But replays appeared to show Pulisic tell his manager 'I'm fine' before he sat on the bench, struggling to keep his emotions in check on a frustrating evening both individually and as a team.

With the score at 0-0 against rivals Canada, Pulisic was visibly frustrated at coming off

Replays showed the winger telling Berhalter that he was 'fine' but the decision remained

It is not the kind of night Pulisic was hoping for as he looked to put in a performance that could help boost his chances of winning a starting spot in Frank Lampard's Chelsea team.

Pulisic has struggled to nail down a regular role in Lampard's side since arriving from Borussia Dortmund for £58million this summer.

He last started in the Premier League on August 31 and is still searching for his first competitive goal at the club.

Expectation on Pulisic was high upon his arrival but the pressure of being an American playing in Europe appears to have weighed heavy on his shoulders.

'It makes you feel really good at the beginning to be honest, you feel great, you see all these things, people talking about you on social media; "wow this kid is great, he's special, he's playing, he's scoring goals at 17 or 18 years old for his national team, he's playing for Dortmund in Europe,"' he told the Players' Tribune.

'You feel really great and then it's more just pressure you feel like all the stuff is kind of hitting you, and you start being expected to do all of these things.

It has been a tough start at Chelsea since he arrived this summer from Borussia Dortmund

Pulisic is still waiting for his first competitive goal for the club as he struggles to get in the side

'This generation can be tough, for young players especially, having people talk about you, having constant pressure on your back.

'Especially as Americans, we haven't had a lot of top international talents throughout our years. If you're not able to tune it out then it can be a weight on your shoulders.'

Despite disappointing in the defeat by Canada, he will hope to play a role this weekend Newcastle visit Stamford Bridge.
description: The 21-year-old was withdrawn on the hour mark with the United States drawing 0-0 with rivals Canada and was unable to hold back the tears on the bench after he came off.
